intro: Exallage kunstleri, commonly known as the Kunstler's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive lobed or serrated margin. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
